definitions.definition: unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well

examples.text: Many of these children are profoundly deaf.
She remained deaf until she died.
She spoke loudly because her mother was a little deaf.
Standing next to the machine all day left her deaf in one ear.

definitions.definition: not willing to listen or pay attention to something

examples.text: He was deaf to my requests for help.
The committee remained deaf to our suggestions.

definitions.definition: to be ignored or not noticed by other people

examples.text: Her advice fell on deaf ears.

definitions.definition: to ignore or refuse to listen to somebody/something

examples.text: He turned a deaf ear to the rumours.

wordOrigin: Old English dēaf, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch doof and German taub, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek tuphlos ‘blind’.
